title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 801.11 - Recording criteria for work-related tuberculosis cases
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 801.11 - Recording criteria for work-related tuberculosis cases

State Regulations
(a) If any of the employer's employees has
been occupationally exposed to anyone with a known case of active tuberculosis
(TB), and that employee subsequently develops a tuberculosis infection, as
evidenced by a positive skin test or diagnosis by a physician or other licensed
health care professional, the employer must record the case on the SH 900 log
by checking the respiratory condition column. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
801.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
